content:
Hi - I just created a new zulip stream for discussing the proposed FHIR Bulk Data API (http://www.healthintersections.com.au/?p=2689) called "bulk data".

Also, the SMART team has released a reference implementation of a FHIR Bulk Data API server designed to help developers explore the proposed API. If youâ€™re attending the Connectathon Bulk Data track this weekend, you can use it when working through the scenarios outlined at http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=201801_Bulk_Data .

The code for the server is at https://github.com/smart-on-fhir/bulk-data-server , an online demo is at https://bulk-data.smarthealthit.org , and we posted a sample command line client at https://github.com/smart-on-fhir/sample-apps-stu3/tree/master/fhir-downloader .

Please post questions and comments to the new stream!
Hi Dan - would be good to get the details of the server in the Connectathon Management tool . :) ...
Hi David - sure, should be set up now (I've also added the server info to the track wiki page)
Reminder - announcements is for announcements only. Responses/discussion should be in the social or implementers stream :)
